{{Infobox football biography | name = Kenneth Zohore | image =Kenneth Zohore.jpg | image_size = | caption = Zohore playing for [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in 2016 | fullname = Albin Kenneth Dahrup Zohore<ref name="FIFAU17-squadlist">{{cite web|title=FIFA U-17 World Cup Mexico 2011 List of Players|url=https://www.fifa.com/mm/document/tournament/competition/01/45/16/03/fu17_2011_squadlists.pdf|work=fifa.com|publisher=[[FIFA]]|accessdate=25 September 2012}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1994|1|31}} | birth_place = [[Copenhagen]], Denmark | height = 1.89 m<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/teams/first-team/forward/kenneth-zohore/ |title=Kenneth Zohore |publisher=Cardiff City F.C. |accessdate=22 December 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Forward (association football)|Striker]] | currentclub = [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] | clubnumber = 10 | youthyears1 = 2002–2006|youthclubs1 = [[BK Skjold]] | youthyears2 = 2006–2009|youthclubs2 = [[Kjøbenhavns Boldklub|KB]] | years1 = 2010–2012|clubs1 = [[F.C. Copenhagen|Copenhagen]] |caps1 = 16 |goals1 = 1 | years2 = 2012–2015 |clubs2 = [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]] |caps2 = 0 |goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2013–2014|clubs3 = → [[Brøndby IF]] (loan)|caps3 = 25|goals3 = 5 | years4 = 2014|clubs4 = → [[IFK Göteborg]] (loan)|caps4 = 5|goals4 = 2 | years5 = 2015–2016|clubs5 = [[Odense Boldklub|OB]]|caps5 = 24 |goals5 = 9 | years6 = 2016 |clubs6 = [[K.V. Kortrijk]]|caps6=0 |goals6 = 0 | years7 = 2016 |clubs7 = → [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] (loan)|caps7=12 |goals7 = 2 | years8 = 2016– |clubs8 = [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]]|caps8 = 78 |goals8 = 22 | nationalyears1 = 2009–2011|nationalteam1 = [[Denmark national under-17 football team|Denmark U17]] |nationalcaps1 = 24 |nationalgoals1 = 13 | nationalyears2 = 2012|nationalteam2 = [[Denmark national under-18 football team|Denmark U18]] |nationalcaps2 = 2 |nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2010–2013 |nationalteam3 = [[Denmark national under-19 football team|Denmark U19]] |nationalcaps3 = 16 |nationalgoals3 = 6 | nationalyears4 = 2013–2017 |nationalteam4 = [[Denmark national under-21 football team|Denmark U21]] |nationalcaps4 = 20 |nationalgoals4 = 8 | club-update = 17:06, 2 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 20:38, 21 August 2017 (UTC) }} '''Albin Kenneth Dahrup Zohore'''<ref name="FIFAU17-squadlist" /> (born 31 January 1994) is a [[Denmark|Danish]] professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[forward (association football)|striker]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].
He began his career in his native Denmark, making his professional debut for [[F.C. Copenhagen|Copenhagen]] at the age of 16, becoming the youngest player to play in the [[Danish Superliga]]. Regarded as a promising youngster, he joined Italian side [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]] in 2012 but struggled to break into the first-team and, following loan spells with [[Brøndby IF]] and [[IFK Göteborg]], he returned to Denmark on a permanent basis by joining [[Odense Boldklub|OB]] in 2015.
==Personal life== Zohore was born in [[Copenhagen]] to a Danish mother and an Ivorian father.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bt.dk/superligaen/fcks-zohore-drogba-er-min-mentor |title=FCK's Zohore: Drogba er min mentor |publisher=bt.dk |language=Danish |date=20 July 2011 |accessdate=21 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.violanews.com/altre-news/lex-viola-zohore-tiene-a-galla-per-ora-litalia/ |title=L’ex viola Zohore regala la qualificazione all’Italia |publisher=Viola News |author=Federico Generelli |language=Italian |date=24 June 2017 |accessdate=18 August 2017}}</ref> His father is the second cousin of former Chelsea striker [[Didier Drogba]].<ref>{{cite web|title=FCK's Zohore: Drogba is my mentor|url=http://www.sporten.dk/superligaen/fcks-zohore-drogba-er-min-mentor|work=Sporten.dk|publisher=[[Sporten.dk]]|accessdate=25 June 2013}}</ref>
==Career==
===Copenhagen=== After spells with [[BK Skjold]] and [[Kjøbenhavns Boldklub|KB]], Zohore joined the youth system at [[F.C. Copenhagen|Copenhagen]], being promoted to the under-19 squad at the age of 15 in 2009. He joined the first-team's training camp in [[Marbella]], Spain, on 2 February 2010 together with Thobias Skovgaard.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://fck.dk/index.php?pageid=754&newsid=9963 |title=Afrejse tirsdag |accessdate=2010-02-03 |date=2010-02-01 |publisher=F.C. Copenhagen |language=Danish }}</ref> He made his professional debut for the club on 7 March 2010, at the age of 16 years and 35 days old,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.superstats.dk/spillere/alder-alltime |title=Yngst/aeldst |publisher=superstats.dk |language=Danish |accessdate=21 August 2017}}</ref> becoming the youngest player to ever make his debut in the [[Danish Superliga]] after replacing [[César Santin]] in the 73rd minute during a 5–0 victory against [[Aarhus Gymnastikforening|AGF]].<ref name="skifter">{{cite web |url=http://fck.dk/nyhedsvisning/?newsid=12286 |title=Kenneth Zohore skifter til Fiorentina |accessdate=2010-03-07 |date=2012-01-31 |publisher=[[fck.dk]] |language=Danish |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120612114933/http://fck.dk/nyhedsvisning/?newsid=12286 |archivedate=2012-06-12 |df= }}</ref><ref name="rfr">{{cite web |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/rise-fall-rise-again-kenneth-12628614 |title=The rise, fall and rise again of Kenneth Zohore: An insight into Cardiff City's prodigious talent who lost his way |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Dominic Booth |date=20 February 2017 |accessdate=18 August 2017}}</ref> However, the match was his only appearance for the first-team during the 2009–10 season.<ref name="Soccerway">{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/kenneth-dahrup-zohore/136137/ |title=K. Zohore |publisher=Soccerway |accessdate=21 August 2017}}</ref>
On 20 October 2010, Zohore made his first [[UEFA Champions League]] appearance for Copenhagen, playing against [[FC Barcelona]] at [[Camp Nou]]. The 16-year-old striker replaced [[César Santin]] in the 74th minute of the game, becoming one of the youngest players ever to play in the Champion's League.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/11/23/10-youngest-champions-league-debutants-including-juventus-moise/kenneth-zohore/ |title=The 10 youngest Champions League debutants including Juventus' Moise Kean – how did their careers pan out? |publisher=The Daily Telegraph |date=23 November 2016 |accessdate=18 August 2017}}</ref> Ten days later, he scored his first senior goal for FC Copenhagen in the Danish Superliga against [[Lyngby Boldklub]]. He is the second youngest goalscorer ever in the Danish Superliga, after [[Mads Beierholm]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.superstats.dk/spillere/alder-alltime?vis=MaalYngst |title=Yngste Malscorere, All-Time |publisher=superstats.dk |language=Danish |accessdate=21 August 2017}}</ref>
Zohore attracted attention from numerous clubs around Europe, spending time on trial at [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], also being approached by Chelsea player Didier Drogba after the two sides met in a Champions League fixture, and [[Inter Milan]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sporten.dk/fodbold/den-nye-bendtner |title=Den nye Bendtner (The new Bendtner) |accessdate=2010-03-07 |date=2010-02-05 |publisher=[[Sporten.dk]] |language=Danish }}</ref> His performances saw him described as "one of the top striking prospects anywhere in the world".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11668/6820678/zohore-reveals-drogba-chat |title=Zohore reveals Drogba 'chat' |publisher=Sky Sports |author=Richard Torgerson |date=18 March 2011 |accessdate=18 August 2017}}</ref>
===Fiorentina & loan spells=== On 31 January 2012, FC Copenhagen announced that Zohore had signed for Italian side [[ACF Fiorentina]] on his 18th birthday for a fee in the region of £1 million.<ref name="skifter"/> He was given shirt no. 33.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.legaseriea.it/c/document_library/get_file?uuid=c539b06c-4a16-4487-8fe1-83f9efefdfb5&groupId=10192 |title=Comunicati Stampa N°123 (2011–12) |date=12 May 2012 |accessdate=1 July 2012 |publisher=Lega Serie A |language=Italian }}{{dead link|date=May 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> However, Zohore never featured for the first team, later stating that he was "too young" to cope with the strong competition for places.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://sport.sky.it/calcio/europei/2017/06/25/zohore-dalla-fiorentina-spinge-l-italia-in-semifinale.html |title=Da meteora viola a eroe, l'Italia ringrazia Zohore |publisher=Sky Sports |language=Italian |date=25 June 2017 |accessdate=18 August 2017}}</ref>
On 8 August 2013, [[Brøndby IF]], managed by Zohore's former coach at Danish youth levels [[Thomas Frank (football manager)|Thomas Frank]], announced that they had agreed a deal with [[ACF Fiorentina]] to sign Zohore on a season-long loan with the option to buy at the end of the year for between €2.2 and €2.3 million.<ref name="bt">{{cite web |url=http://www.bt.dk/superligaen/saadan-har-broendby-kokset-i-zohore-handel |title=Sådan har Brøndby kokset i Zohore-handel |publisher=bt.dk |language=Danish |date=28 July 2013 |accessdate=21 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://brondby.com/nyhed/2013/08/08/kenneth-zohore-til-broendby-if |title=Kenneth Zohore to Brøndby IF |publisher=Brøndby IF |language=Danish |date=8 August 2013 |accessdate=21 August 2017}}</ref> Brøndby paid a loan fee of nearly €100,000 to secure the move, beating off competition from German side [[Hannover 96]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.jv.dk/sport/Saa-meget-skal-Broendby-betale-for-Zohore/artikel/1593204 |title=Så meget skal Brøndby betale for Zohore |publisher=Jydske Vestkysten |author=Søren Sorgenfri |language=Danish |date=26 July 2016 |accessdate=21 August 2017}}</ref> however the transfer nearly collapsed close to completion as Brøndby were unaware of their need to pay Zohore's wages during the loan spell but the loan was eventually completed.<ref name="bt"/> Brøndby were hopeful of completing the transfer on a permanent basis but were unable to meet Fiorentina's valuation.<ref name="juble">{{cite web |url=http://3point.dk/zohore-vil-ikke-juble-hvis-han-scorer-mod-brondby/ |title=Zohore vil ikke juble, hvis han scorer mod Brøndby |publisher=3point.dk |author=Nanna Møller Karlsen |language=Danish |date=11 March 2015 |accessdate=21 August 2017}}</ref>
On 11 August 2014 [[IFK Göteborg]] announced that Zohore had joined the club on a loan deal from Fiorentina.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ifkgoteborg.se/Nyheter/2014/Augusti/Klart-med-Zohore/ | title=Klart med Zohore | publisher=IFK Göteborg | date=11 August 2014 | accessdate=11 August 2014 | language=Swedish | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140915032129/http://www.ifkgoteborg.se/Nyheter/2014/Augusti/Klart-med-Zohore/# | archive-date=2014-09-15 | dead-url=yes | df= }}</ref> He made his debut 13 August 2014 in an away game against Åtvidaberg BK coming on as a substitute. In his home game debut against Brommapojkarna, 17 August 2014, Zohore scored his first goal for IFK Göteborg when he only had been on the pitch three minutes after coming on as a substitute in the 83rd minute.
===Odense Boldklub=== On 3 February 2015, Zohore returned to the Danish Superliga with [[Odense Boldklub]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ob.dk/artikel/ob-skriver-kontrakt-med-kenneth-zohore.aspx |title=OB skriver kontrakt med Kenneth Zohore |accessdate=3 February 2015 |date=3 February 2015 |publisher=Odense Boldklub |language=Danish }}</ref> following the termination of his contract with Fiorentina.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ob.dk/artikel/ob-saelger-kenneth-zohore.aspx|title=OB sælger Kenneth Zohore|last=Wamsler|first=Morten|date=1 February 2016|website=|publisher=Odense Boldklub|language=Danish|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|accessdate=21 August 2017}}</ref>
===Cardiff City=== ====2015–16==== On the final day of the winter transfer window in January 2016, Zohore joined Championship side [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] on loan from Belgian side [[K.V. Kortrijk]], a club also owned by Cardiff chairman [[Vincent Tan]], who signed him that same day from OB for a fee reported to be around £1 million.<ref name="details">{{cite web |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/details-kenneth-zohores-cardiff-city-10821063 |title=The details of Kenneth Zohore's Cardiff City loan as it emerges deal could contain clause to make move permanent |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Chris Wathan |date=1 February 2016 |accessdate=17 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35435452 |title=Kenneth Zohore joins Cardiff City from Vincent Tan's Kortrijk |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 February 2016 |accessdate=1 February 2016}}</ref> At the time, Cardiff were under a transfer ban following a breach of financial fair play rules and were banned from signing players on permanent contracts,<ref name="details"/> although club sources stated that the deal was not made to circumvent the transfer ban and that he was moving to Cardiff to "boost his experience".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cardiff-city-owner-vincent-tan-10811871 |title=Cardiff City owner Vincent Tan set to buy Kenneth Zohore for Belgian club and loan striker to Bluebirds |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Chris Wathan |date=31 January 2016 |accessdate=17 August 2017}}</ref> He made his debut on 6 February in a goalless draw against [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]], coming on as a substitute in place of [[Sammy Ameobi]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35447347 |title=Cardiff City 0–0 Milton Keynes Dons |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 February 2016 |accessdate=18 August 2017}}</ref> He featured frequently in the final months of the 2015–16 season as a substitute, scoring his first goal for the club on 19 April 2016 during a 2–1 defeat against [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35447347 |title=Brentford 2–1 Cardiff City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 April 2016 |accessdate=18 August 2017}}</ref> He was rewarded with his first start for the club in the following match, a 2–1 victory over [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]], during which he scored Cardiff's opening goal.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36060676 |title=Cardiff City 2–1 Bolton Wanderers |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 April 2016 |accessdate=18 August 2017}}</ref> He finished his loan spell having made 12 appearances, scoring twice.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cardiff-city-sign-danish-striker-11574955 |title=Cardiff City sign Danish striker Kenneth Zohore while Idriss Saadi heads out on season-long loan deal |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Anthony Woolford |date=6 July 2016 |accessdate=20 August 2017}}</ref>
====2016–17==== Zohore went on to sign a three-year deal in the Welsh capital in June 2016 for an undisclosed fee.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cardiff-city-sign-danish-striker-11574955|title=Cardiff City sign Danish striker Kenneth Zohore while Idriss Saadi heads out on season-long loan deal|last=Woolford|first=Anthony|date=6 July 2016|website=|publisher=WalesOnline|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|accessdate=6 July 2016}}</ref> However, new manager [[Paul Trollope]], who had replaced [[Russell Slade]] following the end of the previous season, favoured fellow new signings [[Frederic Gounongbe]] and [[Rickie Lambert]] following his appointment with Zohore making only one start in the opening four months of the season, during a 1–0 defeat to [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]] in the first round of the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] on 11 August 2016.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36971967 |title=Bristol Rovers 1–0 Cardiff City (AET) |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 August 2016 |accessdate=20 August 2017}}</ref> With the club struggling, Trollope was replaced by [[Neil Warnock]] and, in December 2016, Zohore impressed as a half time substitute during a 2–1 victory against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].<ref name="surprise">{{cite web |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cardiff-city-manager-neil-warnock-12338343 |title=Cardiff City manager Neil Warnock could cancel January striker search if Kenneth Zohore continues surprise form |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Phil Smith |date=18 December 2016 |accessdate=20 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City 2–1 Wolverhampton Wanderers |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38217655 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 December 2016 |accessdate=13 December 2016}}</ref> Following the match, Warnock praised Zohore's performances in his first two appearances under him, commenting that Zohore had been "a little lazy" during his time at Cardiff and that a transfer away from the club had been considered,<ref name="form">{{cite web |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/remarkable-stats-show-kenneth-zohore-12664557 |title=The remarkable stats that show Kenneth Zohore is in better form than Ronaldo, Higuain, Diego Costa and many more huge stars |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Dominic Booth |date=27 February 2017 |accessdate=20 August 2017}}</ref> but that his improvement meant that he could not "buy anybody better than him at the minute".<ref name="surprise"/> He went onto score his first goal on Boxing Day during a 2–2 draw with [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Brentford 2–2 Cardiff City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38360565 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 December 2016 |accessdate=26 December 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Neil Warnock: Kenneth Zohore will save Cardiff money in transfer market |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38498047 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 January 2017 |accessdate=3 January 2017}}</ref> Zohore was nominated for Championship Player of the Month in February, following a goal against [[Leeds United A.F.C.|Leeds United]] and braces against [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] and [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], but missed out to Leeds' [[Chris Wood (footballer, born 1991)|Chris Wood]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Zohore nominated for Player of the Month |url=http://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/zohore-nominated-for-sky-bet-championship-potm-3615820.aspx |publisher=Cardiff City F.C. Official Site |date=9 March 2016 |accessdate=9 March 2016}}</ref> His 12 goals for Cardiff saw him as the top goalscorer for the season, and he was awarded a contract keeping him at the club until 2020.<ref>{{cite news |title=Kenneth Zohore: Danish striker agrees new Cardiff City deal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39751940 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 April 2017 |accessdate=28 April 2017}}</ref> At the end of the season, he was awarded the club's Young Player of the Year award.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/aron-gunnarsson-big-winner-cardiff-12968468|title=Aron Gunnarsson is the big winner in Cardiff City's 2016/17 awards as Kenneth Zohore is also honoured|last=Booth|first=Dominic|date=30 April 2017|work=|accessdate=30 April 2017|publisher=Wales Online}}</ref>
====2017–18==== Zohore's form at the end of the previous season attracted interest from several clubs with [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]], with an original bid of £6 million,<ref name="Hullbid">{{cite web |url=http://www.hulldailymail.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/hull-city-see-10m-bid-335212 |title=Hull City see £10m bid for Kenneth Zohore rejected by Cardiff City |work=Hull Daily Mail |author=William Jackson |date=16 August 2017 |accessdate=20 August 2017}}</ref> and [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] both having bids rejected by Cardiff.<ref name="nodeal">{{cite web |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/no-deal-place-cardiff-citys-13499799 |title=No deal in place for Cardiff City's Kenneth Zohore to join Brighton as striker prepares for Wolves clash |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Matthew Southcombe |date=19 August 2017 |accessdate=20 August 2017}}</ref> Manager Neil Warnock later commented that Zohore was not for sale and would only leave the club if "I have a heart attack and another manager takes over."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40641182 |title=Kenneth Zohore: Cardiff striker not for sale says manager Neil Warnock |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 July 2017 |accessdate=20 August 2017}}</ref> Zohore scored his first goal of the season in the opening match, the only goal of the game in a 1–0 victory over [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] on 5 August 2017.<ref name="nodeal"/> Following a nine-game goal drought, Zohore scored a brace against [[Leeds United A.F.C.|Leeds United]] on 26 September, in a 3–1 win, before suffering an ankly injury which kept him out until the Christmas Period.<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City 3–1 Leeds United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41315213 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 September 2017 |accessdate=26 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Kenneth Zohore: Cardiff striker on the mend but not ready to play |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42263556 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 December 2017 |accessdate=20 December 2017}}</ref> He returned to the side, replacing [[Omar Bogle]] in a 2–0 defeat at [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] on 23 December, before scoring his fourth of the season against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on [[Boxing Day]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Bolton Wanderers 2–0 Cardiff City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42375402 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 December 2017 |accessdate=23 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City 2–4 Fulham |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42406713 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 December 2017 |accessdate=26 December 2017}}</ref> The new year saw Zohore score 5 goals, including winners against [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] and [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City 1–0 Bristol City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43101660 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 February 2018 |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref> Cardiff finished in 2nd place, gaining promotion to the [[Premier League]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City 0–0 Reading |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43938851 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 May 2018 |accessdate=15 June 2018}}</ref>
====2018-19==== Zohore started the [[2018–19 Cardiff City F.C. season|2018–19]] season as Cardiff's lead striker against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]], however, a string of injuries and bad form saw Zohore in and out of the squad. He scored his first [[Premier League]] goal, in a 2–1 win at [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on 9 February.<ref>{{cite news |title=Southampton 1–2 Cardiff City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47099258 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 February 2019 |accessdate=9 February 2019}}</ref>
==International career== In May 2018 he was named in Denmark’s preliminary 35-man [[Denmark national football team|squad]] for the [[2018 World Cup]] in [[Russia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb|title=Revealed: Every World Cup 2018 squad - 23-man & preliminary lists & when will they be announced? - Goal.com|publisher=}}</ref> However, he did not make the final 23.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.socceroos.com.au/news/confirmed-denmark-cut-ex-arsenal-star-fifa-world-cup-squad|title=Confirmed: Denmark cut ex-Arsenal star from FIFA World Cup squad|website=Socceroos}}</ref>
==Career statistics== {{updated|2 March 2019}}<ref name="Soccerway"/>
{| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|FA Cup !colspan="2"|League Cup !colspan="2"|Champions League !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan="4" valign="center"|[[F.C.
